thread.title: Two arrested after immigration raid on Bideford's 'Posh Wash' car wash

author: Joel Cooper
title: Two arrested after immigration raid on Bideford's 'Posh Wash' car wash
text:
Two arrested after immigration raid on Bideford's 'Posh Wash' car wash "Both men had entered the UK illegally and were detained pending removal from the country." Immigration officers have arrested two men following a raid at a Devon car wash business.
Acting on intelligence, Immigration Enforcement officers visited the Posh Wash car wash on Kingsley Road in Bideford around 5.30pm on Tuesday (October 2.)
Two Albanian men, aged 27 and 42, were arrested. The car wash is based near Bideford Football Club and opposite the town's Morrisons supermarket
A spokesman for the Home Office, which oversees visas and immigration said: "Both men had entered the UK illegally and were detained pending removal from the country. Read More Why I changed my mind over Brexit - Sarah Wollaston
"Where businesses are found to be employing individuals with no right to work, the employer may be liable for a financial penalty of up to Â£20,000 per illegal worker.
"This will be imposed unless the employer can demonstrate that appropriate right-to-work document checks were carried out, such as seeing a passport or Home Office document confirming permission to work." The Posh Wash car wash in Bideford which was raided by immigration officers earlier this week
Information to help employers carry out checks to prevent illegal working can be found at: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/employers-illegal-working-penalties .
This includes a quick answer right-to-work tool to help employers check if someone has the right to work in the UK.
People with information about suspected immigration abuse can visit: https://www.gov.uk/report-immigration-crime or call Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
